wikipedia_page.main:
Abbas Farid (born 10 October 1983) is a British freestyle footballer from Newport, South Wales. Farid is of Pakistani descent.
In June 2003, Abbas was named the Freestyle King on MTV in UK's Nike Freestyle competition, becoming the winner chosen from over 30,000 competitors. He subsequently featured in several music videos for bhangra/desi artists, such as in Jay Sean's music video of Dance with You (Nachna Tere Naal). Abbas has done many performances at football stadiums such as Stamford Bridge, Stade de France, San Siro etc. He still performs at other Sporting/Corporate events and other media promotions around UK and throughout the World. In July 2008 Abbas set a new Guinness World Record of 88 Heel Juggles in 60 seconds.

response: The title is set amongst the inner city streets of London and features performances by freestyle football world champion Abbas Farid, Billy Wingrove, Mike Delaney, Dan Magness, Rob Walters, Faton Gerbeshi, Paul Wood, Joe Davies, Scott Griffiths, Craig Dobson, Al Johnson and basketball freestyler Tommy Baker.
* Abbas Farid – freestyle footballer from Newport, South Wales;

The music video for the song features Sean, Juggy and Rich setting up a block party in a London neighbourhood. In a small scene, the British Asian football freestyler Abbas Farid is also featured juggling with a soccer ball.
* Abbas Farid  freestyle footballer from Newport, South Wales; named the "Freestyle King" on MTV in UK's Nike Freestyle competition
